intro: Sida magnifolia, commonly known as the magnificent sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Sida magnifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
